definitions: To make a solemn promise or undertaking.
To commit (a person or organization) by a solemn promise.
To promise formally to give (money or something else) to a charity or cause.
To drink to the health of (someone or something); toast.
examples: They pledged allegiance to the flag.
She pledged to donate a significant sum.
He pledged his support for the new initiative.
We pledged our loyalty to the company.
